definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
hanging in the balance/the future is hard to forecast/¿Qué serà?/who knows what the future holds?
not knowing what to do next/at a loose end

sentences.english: Suddenly the problem of future loomed tangibly for me.
sentences.chinese: 突然，前途的問題明確地出現在我眼前。

sentences.english: You have a lot of potential, a lot of possibilities within you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你擁有許多潛力，你的發展前途就很大。

sentences.english: One of our promising young officers has begun his training in the Spartan Agoge.
sentences.chinese: 我們有前途的年輕軍官，他一開始在斯巴達教育培訓。

sentences.english: He thinks that the 2 prospects well.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲此礦大有開採前途。
你有沒有考慮你的前途？

sentences.english: She has a future in movies.
I think adhesives are the most promising connection device, Dr.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲黏接劑纔是最有前途的接合方式。

sentences.english: He ruminated over various possibilities concerning his future.
sentences.chinese: 他反覆思考自己前途的各種可能性。

sentences.english: Researches show that Valeriana is a kind of herbal medicine with exploiture future and worthy of researching farther.
sentences.chinese: 纈草是很具有開發前途的中草藥，值得進一步研究。

sentences.english: While challenges remain, Africa has a bright future -- you can bet on it, as countless businesses are doing every day.
sentences.chinese: 雖然挑戰仍然存在，但是非洲的前途將一片光明。

sentences.english: And when we come together and work together, there is no limit to the greatness of America.
sentences.chinese: 當我們一起努力的時候，美國的前途無可限量。

sentences.english: Liu Hua is very optimistic about his future.
sentences.chinese: 劉華對他的前途很樂觀。

sentences.english: You’ve got such promise, yet you’re  squandering it on  malice.
sentences.chinese: 你很有前途，可是你卻將之浪費在惡意揣測上。

sentences.english: A lively sense of looking ahead was a part of the american spirit from the beginning .
sentences.chinese: 充滿活力的瞻望前途，從開始就是美國精神的一部分。

sentences.english: His political future hinges on the outcome of this election.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治前途取決於這次選舉的結果。

sentences.english: The two countries are becoming increasingly interdependent and are closely connected with each other in their future development.
sentences.chinese: 俄中相互依存日益緊密，發展前途密切相關。

definition: not knowing what to do next/at a loose end
hanging in the balance/the future is hard to forecast/¿Qué serà?/who knows what the future holds?
a way out (lit. and fig.)/opportunity for advancement/a way forward/outlet (for one's products)
to have a future full of promise
what course to follow/what path to take
undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
